group_1.textLeft: By the way, Nanaka. Something has been@bothering me.

group_1.textRight: Oh?

group_1.textLeft: You see...
Suzune was aiming very deliberately each@time she went in for the kill.

group_1.textRight: What was she striking at?

group_1.textLeft: Our...Soul Gems.

group_1.textRight: Interesting...

group_1.textLeft: My magic distorts the perceptions of the@target, so it moves in sync with her will.
Even if I lead her one way, the actions she@takes are her own.
And one thing was certain. She was aiming@for the Soul Gem each time.

group_1.textRight: I see.

group_1.textLeft: Well, perhaps it's simply because she is@so thorough.
Our Soul Gems prove we are Magical Girls.@They're the source of our magic.
Oh, and there is one more thing.
Though I have no evidence for this one.
I believe someone already altered her@memories once before.

group_1.textRight: What?!

group_1.textLeft: As I mentioned, it's just a feeling.@Nothing more.
I felt as though I could sense some kind of@interference...
So I thought it was worth mentioning to you.

group_1.textRight: Yes, thank you.
I have something to say to you too, Meiyui.
There's one more favor I need to ask of you.

group_1.textLeft: What is it?

group_1.textRight: Geeze, it's night time already?

group_1.textLeft: Sorry to keep you out this late.

group_1.textRight: Eh, it's no big deal.
Especially 'cause you're gonna treat me to@some nice pastries!

group_1.textLeft: *Giggle* You can have as many as you like!

group_1.textRight: Wow! Well, if you're offering...
[chara:403301:effect_emotion_joy_0][se:7222_happy]Let's see... I'll take a hundred!

group_1.textLeft: H-hey! There IS a limit here, you know!

group_1.textRight: But you just said I could have as many as I@like!

group_1.textLeft: I was just blurting out something to sound@nice, and...ugh!
Anyway! There's no way you could even eat@a hundred!
You're always saying ridiculous,@over-the-top things like that, Arisa!

group_1.textRight: Ohh, another lecture?

group_1.textLeft: Ack! I wasn't...
Anyway!

group_1.textRight: Aww, c'mon, just forget it. Let's get home@already!
We gotta jet all the way from Kamihama@to Hozuki!

group_1.textLeft: Jet, though? We're catching a train, not a@plane.
Shouldn't it be, "ride off"?

group_1.textRight: Don't be so literal!
I would've never thought the girl who created@Dumpling Boy would be so exact with words.

group_1.textLeft: Oh, whatever! Look, it's time to go!

group_1.textCenter: (It was Kyubey's suggestion, but this detour@ended up taking way too long.)
(I should wait for everything to cool down@first.)
I won't forget what happened here.

group_1.textRight: Though I have something to say to you too.
There's one more favor I need to ask of you,@Meiyui.

group_1.textLeft: What is it?

group_1.textRight: I need you to spread another rumor.

group_1.textLeft: A rumor?

group_1.textRight: Suzune...
It's likely she will want to attack other@Magical Girls after this.
We managed to outwit her this time.
But I want to spread a warning to other@Magical Girls about her.

group_1.textLeft: Ah, good idea.

group_1.textRight: We know only a paltry number of Magical@Girls in the grand scheme of things, though.
And that's only in Kamihama.
So we should make it a rumor, and have it@spread far and wide.
If something similar happens in a place@where the rumor has taken root...
The Magical Girls there should be able to@take precautions.

group_1.textLeft: Very true.
If we don't do this, then no information@about her will get out.
Even so...
It's a little crazy putting it into words...
"There's a Magical Girl who hunts other@Magical Girls!"
But I will do what I can.
What kind of rumor should I make?

group_1.textRight: What kind indeed...
An unnerving rumor that strikes fear into@the hearts of those who hear it...
That would be more likely to leave a strong@impression.
Do you think you could come up with something@like that?
Maybe something about a girl who slits the@throats of other girls, perhaps...

group_1.narration: The rumor spread like wildfire online.@Before long, it warped into many different@versions, and those circulated as well.
Ultimately, it changed form enough to@become an urban legend in Hozuki City.
But that is another story entirely.
